processGroups.comments: Two Examples: - Stores dummy data in FTP Server - Read the dataset from FTP and ingest in HDFS

entry.value: INSERT INTO ftp_config ( jobid, ftp_server_hostname, ftp_server_port, ftp_username, ftp_destination_path, ftp_remote_path, hdfs_destination_dir ) VALUES ( '${job.id}', '${ftp.server.hostname}', '${ftp.server.port}', '${ftp.username}', '${ftp.remote.path}', '${ftp.destination.path}', '${hdfs.destination.dir}' );

entry.value: SELECT jobid, ftp_server_hostname, ftp_server_port, ftp_username, ftp_destination_path, ftp_remote_path, hdfs_destination_dir FROM ftp_config WHERE jobid='${job.id}';

config.comments: The processor is getting a list of files in the /nifi-logs directory everyday at 1215

config.comments: This will pull the files specified by the RouteOnAttribute processor. The relationships permission.denied is routed to another processor so the user can get the issues fixed and fetch the file at a later date. The relationship not.found is also routed to another processor so the user is able to understand why an expected file isn't fetched.
We're using the RouteOnAttribute to select only the nifi-app log files for each day All other files in the directory are being ignored for this example.

processors.name: Filter & Select file to fetch from FTP
